Key Arguments: Free speech is a fundamental right and cornerstone of a democratic society.
Free speech encourages diversification of perspectives and vibrant public discourse.
Free speech allows for the identification and addressing of societal injustices and inequalities.
Free speech ensures transparency and accountability within institutions.
Limitations on speech must be carefully defined to avoid encroaching on legitimate opinions.
Notable Quotes: Free speech is a fundamental right that serves as the cornerstone of a democratic society.
By stifling free speech, we risk silencing those who are most vulnerable and inhibiting the quest for social justice.
Any limitations imposed on speech must be carefully delineated and clearly defined to avoid encroaching on the rights of individuals to express legitimate opinions.
